name: 李老师不是你老师
content: How come it started again...

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On August 23, nine departments jointly issued a document to encourage and guide retired teachers and doctors to return to their hometowns to settle down. 
I didn’t expect that this generation of elderly people would experience going to the countryside twice in their lifetime.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Unified reply:

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, the Spring Festival Gala song "My Demands Are Not High" from ten years ago has become popular again on the Internet. The lyrics are full of people's yearning for a happy life at that time: "With money, time, a good job after graduation, food safety is assured, loans can be paid off in ten years, and society is fair. This is my Chinese dream." However, ten years later, netizens sighed that it was indeed a dream.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Breaking news!
Just now, the Associated Press reported that Russian emergency officials said a plane crashed on its way from Moscow to St. Petersburg, killing all ten people on board.
Wagner leader Prigozhin was on the passenger list, but it is not clear whether he was on board.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/VqkReoQhyu

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: The picture of the plane suspected to be carrying Wagner leader Prigozhin when it crashed

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Russian media reported that the Kremlin had received video evidence showing that both Prigozhin and Utkin were on the plane that later crashed. Prigozhin died...

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
In addition to Prigozhin and Utkin, four other senior leaders of Wagner were also on the plane.
The senior leaders of Wagner were wiped out.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Wagner Soldier issued a statement: There is a lot of discussion right now about what the Wagner Group will do. We can tell you one thing. We have already started, please be ready for us.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizens' contributions
Under a Weibo post about Lee Hsien Loong's speech, netizens were all mocking a person who often reads the wrong script

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On August 24, in front of the People's Procuratorate of Nanguan District, Changchun City, Jilin Province. 
Due to the sudden explosion of Guanqun Chicheng, people came to the Procuratorate to protest and demanded that the Chief Prosecutor come forward.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: I've talked about nuclear waste water before.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Lao Li believes that if you are really panicked and angry about the nuclear waste water, you actually have many practical channels to express your demands. You should protest at the Japanese Embassy in China, and you should march on the streets like you did to defend the Diaoyu Islands. You should defend your and your family's right not to drink nuclear waste water with practical actions. Instead of coming here to ask me to talk about it. I am not the president of the country, so what can I say?

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Recently, there was an incident on Xiaohongshu where a person randomly arrested a spy and was slapped in the face.
A Xiaohongshu blogger said that when he was visiting Shitang Town, Wenling, he found a person with a Xiamen University cloth bag on his back, taking photos everywhere, and he might be a spy studying Mazu.
Afterwards, this Xiaohongshu post was discovered by teachers and students of Xiamen University, and after communication, the blogger issued an apology.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: I feel that the domestic network has been hyping up the Japanese nuclear waste water, and the final result is that it will have a fatal impact on the country's seafood industry.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen submissions
All answers on Zhihu that popularized the fact that China's tritium emissions are ten times that of Japan have been deleted

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: To all the netizens who are angry about Fukushima, "Traitor" has found it for you:

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @KFCQZ That's right, if they dared to eat local fruits just two months after the nuclear leak, they would have mutated into Saiyans by now

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 24, the General Administration of Customs of China issued an announcement to suspend the import of Japanese aquatic products from now on.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Netizens on Maimai are still relatively sober

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Posting China’s nuclear wastewater discharge data on WeChat will result in a seven-day ban

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: It seems that providing data is useless, so let me share my opinion. I never said that the nuclear waste water from Fukushima is harmless. What I said is that the harm caused by the nuclear waste water from Fukushima is not as terrible as the Chinese official media has publicized. This is really a very simple logic: China is not the most direct victim of nuclear waste water, and Japan discharges it into its own sea, not directly into China through a tap. If this thing is really that terrible, then Japan is committing suicide, or...

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Li Jianmang @jianmang054A posted a microblog on Weibo saying that the discharge of nuclear wastewater from Fukushima is not that scary. After receiving 12,000 likes, the microblog was deleted and the account was banned.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @jianmang054A To judge something in China, you only need to look at the official operation. If different opinions are deleted directly without even a chance to criticize, it often means that they are afraid of letting more people know.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the evening of August 24, people in Nanchang, Jiangxi Province, protested against Japan's discharge of nuclear waste water at Bayi Square

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the evening of August 24, in Quzhou City, Zhejiang Province, people gathered at the gate of Quzhou Salt Industry Co., Ltd. of Zhejiang Salt Group to grab salt.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: [Click carefully] At around 7:30 pm on August 24, a stabbing incident occurred at RT-Mart in Paojiang, Shaoxing, Zhejiang.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
In 2013, Huanqiu.com reported that a report in the U.S. journal "Immigration and Refugee Studies" showed that Chinese immigrants had higher levels of heavy metals than those from other countries.
All the subjects were from mainland China.

Booming sales! 
On August 24, due to the nationwide rush for salt caused by Japan's nuclear waste water, Douyin's major salt companies' live broadcast rooms sold millions of orders in one day.
